casebody.data:
[Civ. No. 7337. Second Appellate District, Division Two. January 24, 1933.] THE CITY OF LOS ANGELES (a Municipal Corporation), Appellant, v. SADIE D. GRIFFITH ABBOTT et al., Respondents.

Erwin P. Werner, City Attorney, Frederick von Schrader, Assistant City Attorney, and Arthur Loveland, Arthur W. Nordstrom and C. N. Perkins, Deputies City Attorney, for Appellant.

Aubrey Devine and Hyams & Himrod for Respondents.

CRAIG, J.

A motion to tax costs after dismissal of condemnation proceedings having been denied, the plaintiif appeals.

The issues here presented are identical with those urged in City of Los Angeles v. Abbott, decided by this court and numbered Civil No. 7354, ante, p. 144 [18 Pac. (2d) 785], and are governed thereby.

The order is reversed, with directions in accordance with the foregoing decision.

Works, P. J., and Stephens, J., concurred.
